speaker: HAMLET
text: Madam, how like you this play?

speaker: QUEEN
text: The lady doth protest too much, methinks.

speaker: HAMLET
text: O, but she’ll keep her word.

speaker: KING
text: Have you heard the argument? Is there no

speaker: KING
text: offense in ’t?

speaker: HAMLET
text: No, no, they do but jest, poison in jest. No

speaker: HAMLET
text: offense i’ th’ world.

speaker: KING
text: What do you call the play?

speaker: HAMLET
text: “The Mousetrap.” Marry, how? Tropically.

speaker: HAMLET
text: This play is the image of a murder done in Vienna.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Gonzago is the duke’s name, his wife Baptista. You

speaker: HAMLET
text: shall see anon. ’Tis a knavish piece of work, but

speaker: HAMLET
text: what of that? Your Majesty and we that have free

speaker: HAMLET
text: souls, it touches us not. Let the galled jade wince;

speaker: HAMLET
text: our withers are unwrung.

speaker: HAMLET
text: This is one Lucianus, nephew to the king.

text: You are as good as a chorus, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET

text: distempered.

text: some frame and start not so wildly from my

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: affair.

text: I am tame, sir. Pronounce.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: The Queen your mother, in most great

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: affliction of spirit, hath sent me to you.

speaker: HAMLET
text: You are welcome.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: Nay, good my lord, this courtesy is not

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: of the right breed. If it shall please you to make me

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: a wholesome answer, I will do your mother’s

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: commandment. If not, your pardon and my return

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text: shall be the end of my business.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Sir, I cannot.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: What, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text: Make you a wholesome answer. My wit’s

speaker: HAMLET
text: diseased. But, sir, such answer as I can make, you

speaker: HAMLET
text: shall command—or, rather, as you say, my mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Therefore no more but to the matter. My mother,

speaker: HAMLET
text: you say—

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: Then thus she says: your behavior hath

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: struck her into amazement and admiration.

speaker: HAMLET
text: O wonderful son that can so ’stonish a mother!

speaker: HAMLET
text: But is there no sequel at the heels of this

speaker: HAMLET
text: mother’s admiration? Impart.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: She desires to speak with you in her

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: closet ere you go to bed.

speaker: HAMLET
text: We shall obey, were she ten times our mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Have you any further trade with us?

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: My lord, you once did love me.

speaker: HAMLET
text: And do still, by these pickers and stealers.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: Good my lord, what is your cause of

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: distemper? You do surely bar the door upon your

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: own liberty if you deny your griefs to your friend.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Sir, I lack advancement.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: How can that be, when you have the

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: voice of the King himself for your succession in

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text: Denmark?

text: Ay, sir, but “While the grass grows”—the

speaker: HAMLET
text: proverb is something musty.

speaker: HAMLET

text: To withdraw

speaker: HAMLET
text: with you: why do you go about to recover the wind

speaker: HAMLET

text: Believe me, I cannot.

text: I do beseech you.

text: I know no touch of it, my lord.

text: with your fingers and thumb, give it breath with
